sourceDesc.p: Search terms extracted from the following text: Hawkesworth, John, 1715?-1773.An account of the voyages undertaken by the order of His present Majesty: for making discoveries in the Southern Hemisphere, ... By John Hawkesworth, LL.D. In three volumes. ... [pt.2]Londonprinted for W. Strahan; and T. Cadell1773

bibl.author: NA
bibl.title: Beauties of nature and art displayed, in a tour through the world; ... Illustrated and embellished with copper plates.
bibl.note: The name Kihiargo was used in close relation to King George and also in the short passage Tomio and the meantion of a burrial was displayed. This could be a passage that relates to the chapter XIV that I am looking at. This chapter is about Indian Funeral and other observations. Having the name Kihiargo meantioned near bury and also the name Tomio, who is meantioned in the chapter may suggest they are about the same voyage.

bibl.author: NA
bibl.title: A new, authentic, and complete collection of voyages round the world, undertaken and performed by royal authority.
bibl.note: The name Kihiargo was used in close relation to the name King George as it is also in Book I chapter XIV. This is a good indicator that they are actually talking about the same person and would maybe help support what we are looking for. Also the use of islanders and Tubourai Tamaide were meantioned in the short passage in this search for Kihiargo. Tubourai Tamaide was a common name meantioned throughout chapter XIV in relation to the funeral and general observations.

item.note: I tried to search for both the word deity and King George hoping for a few hits and nothing came up relevant to the chapter XIV or our topic. There were 1567 hits and nothing that I tried came up good.
Out of 259 hits the ones that I checked did not have anything to do with the chapter XIV.
